description: Borrowed from Latin spatula (“a flat piece”), the diminutive form of spatha (“broad or flat tool”), from Ancient Greek σπάθη (spáthē, “a broad wood or metal blade”). Doublet of spauld; compare spatha and spathe.

nouns.description: spatula (plural spatulas or spatulae or spatulæ)

entries.meaning: A kitchen utensil consisting of a flat surface attached to a long handle, used for turning, lifting, or stirring food.
examples: Synonyms: fish slice, fish trowel, turner, pancake turner, kitchen turner, cooking turner, flipper

entries.meaning: (Canada, US) A kitchen utensil consisting of a flexible surface attached to a long handle, used for scraping the sides of bowls.
(chemistry) A thin hand tool, often made of nickel, for handling chemicals or other materials, when weighing, etc.
A croupier's tool for turning up cards in a casino.
examples: The croupier delicately faced her other two cards with the tip of his spatula. A four! She had lost!

entries.meaning: (entomology) A sclerotized, T-shaped plate in the prothorax of larvae of flies belonging to family Cecidomyiidae, the gall midges.

verbs.description: spatula (third-person singular simple present spatulas, present participle spatulaing, simple past and past participle spatulaed)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To lift with or as if with a spatula.
